result.execSummary:
The defendant Jervon B McIntosh was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property fr. Person, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration AND the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program only after serving one-half (50%) of his Challenge Incarceration time

Extended Supervision and Probation conditions same
Concurrent with: with Count 2 and as to case 03CM2081

miscConds.notes: As a convicted felon defendant shall NEVER be in possession of any firearm or weapons.

No new law violations reaching the level of a probable cause finding.
No contact with the victims or their place of residence.

Cooperate with agent.
Maintain full time/part time employment and or schooling.
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Random urine screens. No association with drug users, drug dealers, drug houses, or drug dealing.
Participate in any anger management courses, and cooperate fully.
Restitution set at ZERO.
MUST provide a DNA sample to the State of Crime Lab--973.046 & 97.047.
Defendant cannot vote in any election until civil rights are restored.
Participate in a Cognitive Thinking Program or any other programming ordered by the Department, and or the agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jervon B McIntosh

records.addlTxt: Received & Filed, Original SENTENCING Transcript (36 pages) commencing 08/11/2014 by Court Reporter Kelly Pierce.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Count one, per Order signed on 8/15/2014.
Signed and filed, Request and Order to Correct Clerical Error in Judgment of Conviction.  cmt

CORRECTION TO 08-11-2014 SENTENCING HEARING ENTRY: 
Court ordered 97 days credit as to Count 1.  
As a condition of probation, court ordered 6 MONTHS of condition time to be served at the House of Correction with release privileges to the Day Reporting Center and Huber privileges for work, treatment, and school; imposed and STAYED, to be used at the agent's discretion.
Count one
Count two.

BRANCH 26 (POCAN)  FOR BRANCH 21 (BRASH)

Defendant Jervon B McIntosh in court with attorney Victoria M. McCandless.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Statements made as to Sentencing by both counsel and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:  COURT SENTENCED Defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 10 YEARS, to run concurrent to case 13CM002081, and as to Count 2, with credit for 91 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 5 YEARS.  

AS TO COUNT 2:    COURT ORDERED Defendant to serve 2 MONTHS in the House of Correction/Day Reporting Center, to run concurrent to Count 1 and any other sentence with credit for 0 days time served.  

Defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration AND the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Programs only after serving one-half (50%) of his Challenge Incarceration time.

The Court IMPOSED AND STAYED this sentence and placed the Defendant on probation for a period of 3 YEARS to run concurrent as to Count 2 and as to case 03CM002081 with the following conditions:  
*  No new law violations reaching the level of a probable cause finding.
*  Cooperate with agent.
*  Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision, and DNA fees during the period of probation. If revoked, Defendant shall pay up to 25% of prison funds. Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.
*  Maintain full time / part time employment and or schooling.
*  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
*  AODA assessment and treatment.
*  Random urine screens. No association with drug users, drug dealers, drug houses, or drug dealing.
*  Obtain  a GED / HSED / Diploma.
*  Participate in any anger management courses, and cooperate fully.
*  Community service of 40 hours.
*  Restitution set at ZERO.
*  No contact with the victims or their place of residence
*  MUST provide a DNA sample to the State Crime Lab - 973.046 & 97.047
*  As a convicted felon Defendant shall NEVER be in possession of any firearms or weapons.
*  Defendant cannot vote in any election until civil rights are restored.
*  Participate in a Cognitive Thinking Program or any other programming ordered by the Department, and or the agent.

CONDITION OF PROBATION:  COURT SENTENCED Defendant to serve 6 MONTHS at the Day Reporting Center with release privileges for work, treatment, and schooling.

Received and filed with court:
*  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence Form
*  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief Form
*  Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form
*  Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement Form

Attorney Victoria M McCandless in court.  Megan P Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Sentencing Hearing.  Defendant failed to appear; defendant found to be in custody on unrelated matter.  New date selected with the parties.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 11, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jervon B McIntosh in court with attorney Victoria M McCandless.  Megan P Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter calendared for Sentencing hearing.  Parties advised that Branch 21 is unable to hear this matter as the court is in jury trial on an unrelated matter.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 2, 2014 at 08:30 am.
No Contact Order with Martin D.
Bail argument of the parties heard.  Joint stipulation for signature bond granted by the court.

Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

AS TO BOTH COUNTS:  The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Defendant Jervon B McIntosh in court with Attorney Victoria M McCandless.  Defendant Jervon B McIntosh in custody.  Megan P Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Amended Information filed.  Defense counsel acknowledged receipt of a copy of the Amended Information, waived its reading and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant.

Charge amended to:

Count 1:  THEFT FROM PERSON OR CORPSE, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 943.20(1)(a), a Class G Felony

Count 2:  DISORDERLY CONDUCT, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 947.01(1), a Class B Misdemeanor

  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 3, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
AMENDED Information filed.

Attorney Victoria M. McCandless in court, defendant Jervon B McIntosh not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.
Status conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in plea negotiations.  Defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Victoria M. McCandless in court, defendant Jervon B McIntosh not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.
Scheduling conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in negotiations.  Status conference scheduled for March 26, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jervon B McIntosh in court with attorney Victoria M McCandless.  Defendant Jervon B McIntosh in custody.  Megan Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:William Schmitz-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 3, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with MARTIN D.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.
  Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION with DRUG TESTING.

Defendant Jervon B McIntosh in court with attorney Jamie F Cimpl-Wiemer.  Defendant Jervon B McIntosh in custody.  Danielle E. Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge BRASH, Branch 21.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 4, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
